sense.name: a loose page tucked into a publication
sense.examples: Mary removed all the inserts from her new magazine. The Sunday newspaper is full of ad and coupon inserts.

sense.name: an ornamental panel or section of a plain garment
sense.examples: The denim jacket and two beautiful needlepoint inserts on the front. The throw pillows had tooled leather inserts on one side.

sense.name: a local announcement made within a public broadcast
sense.examples: The local congressman paid for an insert during nationally broadcast baseball game. The inserts for a local furniture store are broadcast only locally during the airing of that T.V. show.

sense.name: a shot inserted into a film or video
sense.examples: An insert in the film announced that ten years had gone by. An old photo of the artist was placed as an insert in the documentary about him.
